pull.title: addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by CAddrMan.cs
pull.body:
* Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `CAddrMan.cs `
* Add missing `CAddrMan.cs ` locks

rename.from: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by cs_addrMan
rename.to: addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by cs_addrMan

issue.title: Meta-issue: Add Clang thread safety analysis annotations
issue.body:
This meta-issue tracks the status of the Clang thread safety analysis PRs.

- [x] Fix `-Wthread-safety-analysis` warnings. Compile with `-Wthread-safety-analysis` if available. (#10866)
- [x] travis: Build with `--enable-werror` under OS X (#10923)
- [x] net: Add missing lock in `ProcessHeadersMessage(...)` (#11578)
- [x] addrman: Add missing lock in `Clear()` (CAddrMan) (#11585)
- [x] rpc: Lock `cs_main` in `blockToJSON`/`blockheaderToJSON` (#11618)
- [x] Avoid lock: Call `FlushStateToDisk(...)` regardless of `fCheckForPruning` (#11617)
- [x] tests: Add missing locks to tests (#11623)
- [x] Add missing `cs_wallet`/`cs_KeyStore` locks to wallet (#11634)
- [ ] Add missing locks: `validation.cpp` + related (#11652)
- [x] mempool: Fix missing locking in `CTxMemPool::check(…)` and `CTxMemPool::setSanityCheck(…)` (#11689)
- [x] qt: Remove redundant locks (#11733)
- [x] net: Add missing locks in `net.{cpp,h}` (#11744)
- [x] Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread (#11762)
- [x] net: Avoid locking `cs_vNodes` twice when calling `FindNode(...)`. Add `NodeExists(...)` (#11795)
- [x] tests: Make `test_bitcoin` pass under ThreadSanitzer (`clang`). Fix lock-order-inversion (potential deadlock). (#12882)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_KeyStore` runtime locking assertions (#13077)
- [x] mempool: Add compile time checking for all `::mempool.cs` runtime locking assertions (#13080)
- [x] wallet: Add compile time checking for all `cs_wallet` runtime locking assertions (#13081)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_main` runtime locking assertions (#13083)
- [x] wallet/keystore: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_KeyStore` (#13114)
- [x] addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_addrMan` (#13115)
- [x] Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_{rpcWarmup,nTimeOffset,warnings}` (#13116)
- [x] net: Add Clang thread safety annotations for guarded variables in the networking code (#13123)
- [x] scheduler: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `m_cs_callbacks_pending` (#13125)
- [x] util: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_args` (#13126)
- [x] wallet: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_db` (#13127)
- [x] policy: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_feeEstimator` (#13128)
- [x] Move `cs_main` locking annotations from `.cpp` to `.h` (#14063)
- [x] tests: Add missing locking annotations and locks (`g_cs_orphans`) (#14108)
- [x] Add compile time checking for `cs_main` locks which we assert at run time (#14444)

events.body: <!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 84 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.
@MarcoFalke Would you mind reviewing this one? Should hopefully be trivial :-)

issue.title: wallet: Remove unused local variable old_label
issue.body:
Remove unused local variable `old_label`.

Last use was removed in #13825.

issue.title: p2p: Return a max of 1000 addrs from CAddrMan::GetAddr
issue.body:
This is the documented max size for an addr response, and was separately being
limited in PushAddress to 1000 via MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND. No point in selecting a
too-large random set then filtering it randomly down to a smaller set.

events.body: @Empact @promag @ajtowns Would you mind reviewing? Should hopefully be trivial :-)
Should squash or invert commit order otherwise 1st commit is broken? Also why rename `CAddrMan::cs` to `CAddrMan::cs_addrMan`?

Unrelated [feature_notifications.py failure](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/DrahtBot/bitcoin/builds/19342222) in appveyor:
```
test  2018-10-08T14:19:56.724000Z TestFramework (ERROR): Unexpected exception caught during testing 
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "C:\projects\bitcoin\test\functional\test_framework\test_framework.py", line 172, in main
      self.run_test()
    File "C:\projects\bitcoin/test/functional/feature_notifications.py", line 55, in run_test
      os.remove(os.path.join(self.walletnotify_dir, tx_file))
  PermissionError: [WinError 32] The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process: 'C:\\Users\\appveyor\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\1\\test_runner_20181008_141018\\feature_notifications_38\\walletnotify\\0b3efb8afc557368538b69c082c9f343b4d9c3f52145405438b98a1384fe13ad'
```

~~utACK 116e77b~~.

nits:
 - commit messages could mention `CAddrMan`.
 - could squash.

events.message: Add missing locks and locking annotations for CAddrMan

events.body: @promag Thanks for the quick review. Feedback addressed. Please re-review :-)

@promag I'm not sure I follow here. Is you suggestion to drop all the `EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED`:s in this PR? Then it won't compile due to warnings such as:

```
addrman.cpp:70:44: error: reading variable 'mapAddr' requires holding mutex 'cs' [-Werror,-Wthread-safety-analysis]
addrman.cpp:71:15: error: reading variable 'mapAddr' requires holding mutex 'cs' [-Werror,-Wthread-safety-analysis]
addrman.cpp:75:46: error: reading variable 'mapInfo' requires holding mutex 'cs' [-Werror,-Wthread-safety-analysis]
[…]
```

What am I missing? :-)

rename.from: addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by cs_addrMan
rename.to: addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by CAddrMan.cs

events.body: @MarcoFalke Would you mind re-reviewing your previous utACK? :-)

issue.title: merge #17812, #16702, #16730, #18023: supplying and using asmap to improve IP bucketing in addrman
issue.body:
## Overview

As part of https://github.com/dashpay/dash/pull/4025, component pull requests that are required by TorV3 logic are being broken down into branches wherever feasable. This PR deals with asmap related address logic.

## Contents

* Merge https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16702 ("p2p: supplying and using asmap to improve IP bucketing in addrman" by naumenkogs)
* Merge https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16730 ("Support serialization of std::vector<bool>" by sipa)
* Merge https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17812 ("config, net, test: asmap feature refinements and functional tests" by fanquake)

## Disclosures

* Dash-specific changes may not have been tested, only compilation has been ensured. Running the client on (a) testnet(s) may be necessary.
* Contains squashed patches bb8958d, 7d2eb46d97bf4ffe88dc97324d5f27de51c2ddaf and 9ad5d1d from UdjinM6

issue.title: [Backport] Ensure tried collisions resolve, and allow feeler connections to existing outbound netgroups
issue.body:
Two pretty direct back ports for the address manager.
Coming from #13115 and #15486.

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.18 locking PRs
issue.body:
These are locking changes from upstream (bitcoin core) release 0.18 (Aug 13, 2018, to Mar 3, 2019), oldest to newest (when merged to the master branch).

UPDATE 2021-May-4: This PR is complete, ready for review.

NOTE: This PR's branch is based on #5034, which hasn't merged yet, so its commits appear here also. For the current PR, please review only commit "Add missing locks and locking annotations for CAddrMan" and beyond (I will remove this comment before this PR gets merged.)

Each commit also includes a reference both to the PR and the upstream commit.

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13115
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14444
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11634
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13123
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14953
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14993
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12151
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12153
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15322
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15321
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15201
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15365

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: I-race
labels.description: Problems and improvements related to race conditions.
